description:
Marasco & Nesselbush, LLP: Hard Work, Honesty, Intelligence And Integrity Are The Hallmarks Of Our Law Firm

At Marasco & Nesselbush, LLP, our team of attorneys and professional staff are dedicated to obtaining extraordinary results for each and every client. As experienced personal injury, Social Security Disability and medical malpractice attorneys, we understand the challenges facing injured individuals and their families. For many, the aftermath of a car accident or other incident that results in an injury can be a confusing and stressful time. By working closely with you, we will review all aspects of your case, take on the insurance companies on your behalf, and pursue the full and fair compensation you need to cover medical bills, lost wages and other expenses that may arise.

Since opening our doors in 1999, we have focused our efforts on providing the counsel, support and representation our clients deserve. By bringing our best to every case, we have recovered millions of dollars on behalf of our clients. No matter whether you or a loved one suffered minor injuries, or have been in an accident that resulted in a life-changing disability, we will place all our skill and resources at your disposal.

Personal injury law is an expansive practice area encompassing numerous niche areas of the law. Some of the most common types of cases we see include:

  • Car, truck and other motor vehicle accidents
  • Catastrophic injuries that may result in temporary or permanent disabilities
  • Medical malpractice
  • Product liability
  • Slip and fall as well as other premises liability
  • Social Security Disability
  • Wrongful death cases

After an accident, it's important to reach out to an experienced lawyer as soon as possible. We invite you to contact us at Marasco & Nesselbush, LLP, to learn how we can help you. Call us and schedule a free initial consultation at one of our seven office locations, including: Providence, Warwick, Woonsocket and Wakefield, Rhode Island, Lawrence and Quincy, Massachusetts, and New London, Connecticut.
